org.opentosca.toscana.api

Class PlatformController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opentosca.toscana.api.PlatformController

  • @CrossOrigin
 @RestController
 @RequestMapping(value="/api/platforms")
public class PlatformController
extends java.lang.Object
    This REST Controller handles every request to list the supported Platforms and to retrieve information about a specific platform.

    For sample Responses of the Requests, please have a look at docs/api/api_samples.md

    • Method Detail

      • getPlatforms

        @RequestMapping(path="",
                method=GET,
                produces="application/hal+json")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.hateoas.Resources<PlatformResponse>> getPlatforms()
        Lists all Supported Platforms (HTTP Response Method).

        It handles the /platforms Request

        Always responds with HTTP-Code 200 (application/hal+json)

      • getPlatform

        @RequestMapping(path="/{id}",
                method=GET,
                produces="application/hal+json")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<PlatformResponse> getPlatform(@PathVariable(name="id")
                                                                                                                                                                                        java.lang.String id)
        Returns the information for a specific platform.

        This method handles the /platforms/{id} request

        jResponds with Http code 200 normally (application/hal+json) and with code 404 (application/hal+json, standard error message) if the platform with the given name (case sensitive) does not exist.

        Parameters:
        id - the id (identifier) of the platform (HTTP Path Parameter)
